intro: Anarmodium, commonly known as the sea holly, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking, often blue or purple, ray flowers surrounded by a dense ring of bracts that resemble leaves. These plants are typically found in coastal or saline environments, showcasing their adaptability to harsh conditions. The bracts are not only ornamental but also serve as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Anarmodium species are often cultivated for their aesthetic value in gardens and coastal landscapes.
